summary: Black Sabbath was an English rock band formed in 1968 by Tony Iommi, Bill Ward, Geezer Butler, and Ozzy Osbourne. They are considered pioneers of heavy metal music. The band's first three albums, released between 1970 and 1971, defined the genre. After Osbourne left in 1979, the band had many lineup changes, with Iommi as the only constant member. They released several successful albums with different vocalists, including Ronnie James Dio. Black Sabbath reunited with Osbourne in 1997 and again in 2011 for tours and new music. The band is one of the most successful heavy metal groups, selling over 70 million records and winning multiple awards.
title: Black Sabbath
